title: Can i use LVOC (Lol Voice Changer) to change the voice in game???

embed.description: This application allows you to change the language of the in-game and champ select audio for League of Legends to any of your choosing (Japanese, Korean, Spanish, Turkish, etc.) provided that the language is supported by Riot.

body: I want to change the voice in game to Japanese, and have already done lots of research but only found "lvoc" as the only method to change the in-game voice. But isn't it also be counted as a third software? Will i get ban for this? Sorry for my bad English, come from Japan. Thanks for help xD

replies.body: We don't support modifications or third parties, so it's at your own risk.  We may not ban for it currently, but we can't help you if you run into technical issues or malicious contents are found hidden within.  Check out our[ third party guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/225266848), and be safe.  I couldn't offer any help in setting this up, each language has their own [supported language](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751594-Changing-Game-Language) per our guide.  Sorry, friend!

Does the whole  not banning for changing the in game voices still apply? Cause  yeah, I know its a two month old comment, but a ton of things can change in two months.  Cause I really dont want to risk getting a ban if things have changed.

The voice changing feature is still not something that's being actioned on, but again, these applications should be used *at your own risk* as any unapproved third-party applications could be malicious to your system or have features that violate the Terms of Use/EULA.
